case_title: FAZAL-E-HADI vs NATIONAL ACCOUNTABILITY BUREAU, SINDH through Director-General, Sindh and another
respondent: National Accountability Bureau, Sindh through Director-General, Sindh and another

prosecution_case.allegations: Demanding Rs. 1 million cash or GLI Toyota car for excluding complainant's name from inquiry and softening the role of colleague Shahid Raza
prosecution_case.plea_bargain_offer: Rs. 7,45,700 (including Rs. 6,50,000 illegal gratification and 15% NAB accidental charges)

contradictions: No mention of illegal demand in complainant's initial application for pardon
Discrepancies in raiding report and reference
Telephonic conversation not verified by expert
procedural_flaws: Seized car returned to applicant's wife after 36 days

evidence: Letter dated 21st May, 2007 showing applicant authorized as Investigating Officer
Recovery of tainted money corroborated by complainant and Judicial Magistrate
Affidavit of plea bargain dated 14th July, 2007
Handwritten letter by applicant admitting mistakes and requesting pardon
prosecution_arguments.case_strength: Minor contradictions do not affect prosecution case; prima facie evidence established

judgment_summary.reasoning: Applicant admitted receiving money, offered plea bargain, and requested pardon in writing. Corruption by NAB officials undermines the institution's credibility.
